node.title: Boris Johnson says climate deal is 'death knell' for coal
node.alt: Man in a suit behind a podium gives a press conference.
node.description: Boris Johnson says agreements from most countries to stop funding overseas fossil fuel projects are a major advance in the fight against climate change.
node.content:
["UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson says the deal agreed at the COP26 climate talks in Scotland sounds the \"death knell for coal power\".", "But he said his delight at the progress made during the COP talks was \"tinged with disappointment\".", "In a major shift demanded by coal-dependent India and China, the Glasgow climate pact agreed over the weekend used watered-down language about \"phasing down\" the use of coal instead of \"phasing out\" coal.", "But Mr Johnson highlighted an agreement which will see countries in western Europe and North America\u00a0pull the plug on financial support for all overseas fossil fuel projects by this time next year.", "Mr Johnson said the compromise on \"phasing down\" coal use would not make \"that much of a difference\".", "\"It's an immense thing to get a commitment from 190 countries to phase down or phase out coal,\" he said.", "\"The direction of travel is pretty much the same.\"", "", "
The COP26 president says he is \"deeply sorry\" for the last-minute changes to the climate deal.
", "Ending coal is seen as the key to reducing greenhouse gas emissions.", "But\u00a0Mr Johnson acknowledged that some countries did not live up to the ambition of the summit.", "He accepted the Glasgow summit did not deliver the \"full solution\" to climate change, but said the world was \"undeniably heading in the right direction\".", "\"We can lobby, we can cajole, we can encourage, but we cannot force sovereign nations to do what they do not wish to do,\" he said.", "\"It's ultimately their decision to make and they must stand by it.\"", "He and conference president Alok Sharma both underlined that the Glasgow Climate Pact was the first time that coal had been mentioned in UN climate agreements.", "But Mr Sharma said China and India would have to \"justify\" their actions.", "\"On the issue of coal, China and India are going to have to justify to some of the most climate-vulnerable countries what happened,\" he said.", "Australia committed to net zero emissions by 2050 coming into COP26, but did not agree to phase out coal or to\u00a0end funding for coal projects.\u00a0", "The head of the Climate Council, Simon Bradshaw, said Australia had cemented its reputation as a climate laggard at the conference, and let down its Pacific neighbours.", "\"The government's own net zero modelling \u2026\u00a0predicts Australia will still be a major coal and gas exporter in 2050,\" he said.", "AP/ABC"]
